Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) include over 11,294 new packages and updates to over 72% of all packages in the distribution. It supports various architectures and includes several desktop environments. Other new features include driverless scanning and printing, a new generic open command, control groups v2, a persistent systemd journal, a new Fcitx 5 input method, improved man page translations, improved support for alternative init systems, and kernel support for exFAT.

Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) include over 11,294 new packages and updates to over 72% of the software packages in the distribution. It supports various architectures, including 32-bit and 64-bit PCs, ARM, MIPS, PowerPC, and IBM System z. The distribution includes several desktop environments, such as GNOME 3.38, KDE Plasma 5.20, LXDE 11, LXQt 0.16, MATE 1.24, and Xfce 4.16. Other new features include driverless scanning and printing, a new generic open command, control groups v2, a persistent systemd journal, a new Fcitx 5 Input Method, improved man page translations, improved support for alternative init systems, and kernel support for exFAT. The Debian Med team has also added new packages in the field of life sciences and medicine, with more existing packages gaining Continuous Integration support. 
 
 Links: [' (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-about.en.html)', ' (https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-installing.en.html)', '2.1.
